name: Coded Element
description: The CE data type transmits codes and the text associated with the code. It is used to represent coded values where both the identifier and its human-readable description need to be communicated. Supports primary and alternate coding systems for flexibility in healthcare data exchange.

CE.1.name: Identifier
CE.1.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the text.

CE.2.name: Text
CE.2.description: Name or description of the item in question (e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression). This is the corresponding text assigned by the coding system to the identifier.

CE.3.name: Name of Coding System
CE.3.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique name (coding system identifier). This component identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component.

CE.4.name: Alternate Identifier
CE.4.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the text. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

CE.5.name: Alternate Text
CE.5.description: Name or description of the item in question using an alternate coding system (e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression).

CE.6.name: Name of Alternate Coding System
CE.6.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique name (coding system identifier). This component identifies the alternate coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

constraints.minimum: To allow all six components to be valued, maximum length must be at least 60
constraints.uniqueness: The combination of identifier, name of coding system, and coding system version ID components will be a unique code for a data item

usage: Observation identifiers in OBR and OBX segments
Drug codes in RXE, RXD, RXG segments
Any field requiring coded values with text descriptions

generationHints.typical: Use standard medical coding systems like ICD-9, ICD-10, CPT, LOINC
generationHints.patterns: Primary identifier should match the coding system; alternate can provide cross-references
generationHints.required: CE.1 (Identifier) should always be populated; text components improve readability
